t: Blessed*pn is the one who*ld does not walk in step with the wicked or*ln stand in the way that sinners take or*ld sit in the company of mockers,
but*ln whose delight is in the law of the Lord,*s and*ld who meditates on his law day and night.
That*ln person is like a tree planted by streams of water, which*ld yields its fruit in season and*ln whose leaf does not wither— whatever*ld they do prospers.
Not*pn so the wicked! They*ld are like chaff that*ld the wind blows away.
Therefore*ln the wicked will not stand in the judgment, nor*ld sinners in the assembly of the righteous.
For*pn the Lord*s watches over the way of the righteous, but*ld the way of the wicked leads to destruction.
